definitions.definition: ( usually uncountable ) The skin or outer layer of a fruit, vegetable, etc.
( countable , rugby ) The action of peeling away from a formation.
( countable ) A cosmetic preparation designed to remove dead skin or to exfoliate .

main_definition: ( usually uncountable ) The skin or outer layer of a fruit, vegetable, etc.
secondary_definitions: ( countable , rugby ) The action of peeling away from a formation.
( countable ) A cosmetic preparation designed to remove dead skin or to exfoliate .

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) A fence made of stakes; a stockade .
( archaic ) A small tower , fort , or castle ; a keep .

secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) A fence made of stakes; a stockade .
( archaic ) A small tower , fort , or castle ; a keep .

definitions.definition: A shovel or similar instrument, now especially a pole with a flat disc at the end used for removing pizza or loaves of bread from a baker's oven.
A T-shaped implement used by printers and bookbinders for hanging wet sheets of paper on lines or poles to dry.
( archaic , US ) The blade of an oar .

main_definition: A shovel or similar instrument, now especially a pole with a flat disc at the end used for removing pizza or loaves of bread from a baker's oven.
secondary_definitions: A T-shaped implement used by printers and bookbinders for hanging wet sheets of paper on lines or poles to dry.
( archaic , US ) The blade of an oar .

definitions.definition: ( Scotland , curling ) An equal or match ; a draw .
( curling ) A takeout which removes a stone from play as well as the delivered stone.

main_definition: ( Scotland , curling ) An equal or match ; a draw .
secondary_definitions: ( curling ) A takeout which removes a stone from play as well as the delivered stone.

definitions.definition: Alternative form of peal ( “ a small or young salmon ” ) .

main_definition: Alternative form of peal ( “ a small or young salmon ” ) .
